byline.contributor: Lilia Blaise reported from Brussels, and Aurelien Breeden from Paris. Reporting was contributed by Kimiko de Freytas-Tamura from Brussels, Melissa Eddy and Alison Smale from Berlin, Benoît Morenne from Paris, Sewell Chan from London, Eric Schmitt from Washington, and Rukmini Callimachi, Neil Collier and Rick Gladstone from New York.
byline.original: By LILIA BLAISE and AURELIEN BREEDEN

abstract: Counterterrorism officials expand sweep aimed at suspected Islamic State operatives to several European countries, reporting newly discovered links between the Brussels and Paris attacks, at least five arrests and thwarting of advanced plan for another attack; actions reflect renewed momentum spurred by information uncovered after Brussels bombings and deep regret over missed chances to thwart attacks
lead_paragraph: Najim Laachraoui, 24, who blew himself up at Brussels Airport, made two of the explosive vests used in the assaults on the French capital in November.

headline.main: Sweep Leads to 5 Arrests, a Foiled Plot and a Paris-Brussels Connection
headline.print_headline: Sweep Leads to 5 Arrests, a Foiled Plot and a Paris-Brussels Connection

snippet: Najim Laachraoui, 24, who blew himself up at Brussels Airport, made two of the explosive vests used in the assaults on the French capital in November.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
